meanings.definition: Consisting of, forming, or arranged in a series.
meanings.sent1: The TV show tells a serial story that continues from one episode to the next.
meanings.sent2: She watched the serial numbers on the assembly line increase one by one.
meanings.sent3: The serial arrangement of the books on the shelf made it easy to find her favorite novel.
meanings.sent4: His serial approach to organizing his tasks helped him stay on track.
meanings.sent5: The serial order of the colors in the rainbow is always the same.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to or occurring in a series.
meanings.sent1: The serial episodes of the podcast kept her eagerly waiting for the next one.
meanings.sent2: The serial nature of the experiments allowed for accurate data comparison.
meanings.sent3: His serial habit of checking his phone every few minutes became a running joke among his friends.
meanings.sent4: The serial progression of the seasons reminded her of the passage of time.
meanings.sent5: The serial order of the alphabet is crucial for understanding language.

meanings.definition: A work, as a work of fiction, published in installments.
meanings.sent1: She eagerly awaited each new chapter of the thrilling serial in the magazine.
meanings.sent2: The bookstore had a special section dedicated to classic literary serials.
meanings.sent3: The detective serial in the newspaper always left readers guessing until the next edition.
meanings.sent4: The author's latest serial captivated readers with its suspenseful plot twists.
meanings.sent5: The TV network decided to air the popular serial twice a week due to high demand.
